definition: to fly into a rage/to rage violently

sentences.english: Fixed Lightning Fury to do initial weapon damage.
sentences.chinese: 確實用縮寫名籤武器損壞固定的閃電暴怒。

sentences.english: The chattering of teeth from the cold or from rage.
sentences.chinese: 牙齒因爲寒冷或暴怒而震顫。

sentences.english: But the unlucky beast's defences were no match for the raging hippos.
sentences.chinese: 但是這不幸的野獸的防衛豈能和河馬的暴怒同日而語。

sentences.english: The criminal knifed his victim in a rage.
sentences.chinese: 那個罪犯暴怒之下用刀砍了被害者。

sentences.english: The frog frowned at her words and became furious.
sentences.chinese: 青蛙對她的話皺眉並且暴怒起來。

sentences.english: LinZhenHai furious rally team prepare for extremely in water revenge.
sentences.chinese: 林振海暴怒至極集結隊伍準備爲於得水報仇。

sentences.english: Savage Fury" no longer applies to " Maul" or "Swipe".
sentences.chinese: 野蠻暴怒不再影響熊的槌擊和掃擊。

sentences.english: The second belief often leads to rage, passive-aggression and acts of violence.
sentences.chinese: 第二種信念往往帶來暴怒，消極的攻擊和暴力行爲。

sentences.english: I was furious with the sun; it burnt down on me so angrily, small blisters formed on my skin.
sentences.chinese: 烈日烤得我暴怒，讓我快瘋了，皮膚上冒起了水泡。

sentences.english: The king flew into a terrible rage. He was so overcome by anger that he decided to take vengeance against all dogs.
sentences.chinese: 國王大發雷霆，在暴怒之下他決定報復所有的狗。

sentences.english: Her face became distorted with a fury that verged on madness.
sentences.chinese: 她的臉因爲近乎瘋狂的暴怒而變得扭曲。

sentences.english: The fury on Holly's face turned to horror.
sentences.chinese: 霍麗臉上的暴怒消失了，取而代之的是恐懼。

sentences.english: Islamabad reacted with fury to the attack.
sentences.chinese: 伊斯蘭堡對襲擊的反應是暴怒。

sentences.english: At the time, Cantor’s theory provoked not just resistance, but outrage.
sentences.chinese: 在當時，康託的理論引發的不光是抵制，還有暴怒。

definition: stamp with fury/fly into a rage
to roar/to thunder/to snarl/to bluster (of wind, waves etc)/crashing waves (onom.)/to rage (of a person)
unable to restrain one's anger (idiom); in a towering rage
